page.title: 13FARMING AND BUSINESS
page.content: FARMING IS ARABLE AND MIXED IN EQUAL PROPORTIONS. GRAIN IS THE MAIN CROP ON LAND AWAY FROM NORMAL FLOOD LEVELS. SOME LAND IS USED FOR SOFT FRUIT, MAINLY STRAWBERRIES. THERE ARE STILL MANY SMALL ENCLOSED PASTURES BUT THERE IS A GROWING TENDENCY TO OPEN OUT LARGE ARABLE FIELDS. ALONG THE INGS THE PASTURE LAND IS OPEN AND GRAZED BY CATTLE AND SHEEP. PONIES AND HORSES OCCUPY PADDOCKS ROUND FARMS. ONE NUN MONKTON FARMER BREEDS TROTTING PONIES FOR SALE AND EXPORT. THREE LARGE FARMS ARE GROUPED TOGETHER TO FORM A LIMITED COMPANY SUPPLYING GRAIN FOR A BISCUIT FIRM. ALSO CONNECTED IS A SPIRIT AND WINE WHOLESALE COMPANY. FARMING IS MECHANISED, THERE ARE FEW FARM WORKERS EMPLOYED AND NO LIVING-IN FARM SERVANTS. SOME HAY IS PRODUCED BUT SILAGE MAKING IS INCREASING.
